name: The Fairmont Orchid, Hawaii

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in early September 2013. We booked directly through Fairmont and being a Fairmont Premier member, I had a "stay 3, get 1 night free" award and also a suite upgrade award, both which I was able to use for this trip. So the value of both together saved me quite a lot of money. I ended up paying less than $300 a night for an Suite, and then the hotel upgraded me further to a ocean view suite. Great deal!
reviews.title: Great time at the Fairmont, and great value
great place with some tweaks needed
reviews.text: Rooms: A-

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Out suite was spacious with a great view. Bed was super comfy and there were nice lounge chairs out on the balcony. Bathroom was large (shower/tub and also separate stand up shower), however my only complaint was that I felt the bathroom could have been cleaned better. The shower door had some soap residue, and sections of the tile were not that clean.
reviews.title: Unexpectedly Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grounds: A+
reviews.title: Hawaii - Tale of Two Fairmonts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Beautiful location on the island, and they keep the property looking fantastic. Beautiful flowers everywhere you turn, and great waterfalls. It's directly on the beach, so easy access to calm waters.
reviews.title: Paradise on the Big Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here three times. Every time for a meeting. Every time was perfect. The hotel takes care of all the necessities, the food in the deli is good, at the restaurant-great (if pricey)... and, of course, the surrounding areas are gorgeous. Picture perfect, to be precise. Location is also excellent -- Kona is a short (twenty minute) drive away -- with all the pleasures of that town. Mauna Kea observatory, Volcano, and Hilo are also perfectly driveable. Overall -- a great stay. Do take advantage of the hot-tub in the bushes and sign up for President's club for free internet access, running shoes, and other perks.
reviews.title: Great place to be on the Big Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Fairmont because my niece got married here so we came for the wedding and stayed for a week. The wedding was perfect. Getting married at turtle point was the most beautiful place to get married. The wedding was perfect. If you are thinking about getting married here you can not go wrong. They offer a special wedding rate to your guests which is why we were able to stay here a week.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, great service but you pay for it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place are this place is beautiful. Every were you look it's amazing. The grounds, beach and pool areas are so well kept. There are fresh flowers everywhere.
reviews.title: superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The staff really is great. I feel I received five star service the whole time I was here. Everyone on the staff treats you like a valued guest.
reviews.title: Extremely expensive, but a piece of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Browns restaurant was awesome. One of the most beautiful places I have ever eaten. Get a ocean side table and you will not be disappointed. The food, service and beauty are amazing. We eat here on our last day and I am so glad we did. We got the 3 course dinner for $69 per person.it was super yummy and so worth it. This is also the cheapest thing on menu so know if you eat here it's going ton cost you. Our bill with tip was $180 and we had no cocktails and stuck to tasting menu.
reviews.title: One of the best vacations of my life. Amazing hotel & staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights here at this beautiful location right on the water. We were located on the 5th floor of the north tower, it was an easy walk to both the pool and the beach. Our favorite in hotel place to hang out was the Luana Lounge. They happy hour was a good deal, and I would recommend the Luana cooler it was the perfect drink to refresh from the hot day on. The grounds of the hotel were beautifully manicured and everything seemed in its place all the time.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, with under whelming service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: What makes it an average stay in my mind was the underwhelming service and various shortcomings here and there. With the exception of the valet staff, everyone else seemed to be just existing and passing the hours until their shift was over. There was not a sense of welcome and helpfulness that I expect from up scale hotels. The Four Seasons is a stunning example of service and having been the most recent hotel I stayed in before here I was spoiled there. The optional nightly refresh seemed to be a strange option and should be just taken care of automatically. Also the last two nights we were there the maids didn't leave towels, and the room only seemed marginally cleaned.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been to other Fairmont properties and this one left much to be desired. I do not plan on returning to the Fairmont Orchid.
reviews.title: a succession of little failures

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here with my family of 5 (kids 11, 8, 7) booked connecting rooms. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable. The bed was one of the best hotel beds i have slept in. The kind where you kind of hope for a rainy day so you can lay in it all day. There is an ipod dock, which sure comes in handy when we all have to charge our phones and only brought 1 charger. The bathroom is white marble and very clean. The toiletries were great, Le Labo, and large sizes. The pool is warm, large and lagoon style. The cabanas were great for our kids for only $40 a day. It came with a cooler filled with water, nuts, and fruit. The poolside service was excellent, they were constantly walking around. Yes the food and drinks are pricey but it is the Fairmont. The poolside restaurant was very good. Directly in front of it is the turtle viewing spot where turtles come up during the day and night to take a break. The beach is a short walk to the left. If you plan on renting water equipment more than one day, ask about the activity card for $75. The lagoon is protected, so great for little ones. Turtles, puffer fish, eels and lots of tropical looking fish. We ate at Browns Beach House twice and loved it. The service was impeccable and the atmosphere was relaxed. If you plan on staying here, sign up for the Presidents Club, it's free and you will get certificates for your stay like $25 dining certificate or spa discounts. Also, this hotel is very quiet. If you are looking for nightlife or nighttime atmosphere don't stay here. The lounge opens around 5pm and has happy hour (no happy hour at pool or beach bars :( ). They only have live music during happy hour, which is disappointing since there are no other options.
reviews.title: Quiet Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, the location and setting of the property is fabulous. The swimming beach is perfect for all ages and the snorkeling is crazy good, for only having to stroll off your beach chair into the water. We literally swam with turtles, myriads of beautiful fish, and even a puffer fish within 100 yards of the beach. The beach area is the gem of this property, and the rooms have been tastefully updated. But, unfortunately, that is where the greatness stops. The service, with few exceptions, was entirely underwhelming. It started at check in when our room wasn't ready. Understandable, as it was before check-in time. We provided our cell phone number and waited, and waited, and waited...until an hour after check-in. Upon calling the front desk and asking if our room was ready, we were told that it was, and the front desk associate who was going to call us, had left for the day. Their excuse - they only had our home phone number. Really ? An apology instead of a lame excuse would have been far more acceptable. When we asked about an expected room amenity for President's Club guests, we were told they don't do it anymore...called the 800 corporate number, told a different story and the gift showed up later in the day. They bungled our golf clubs, and then we were told we would get a call from the manager. Crickets. no call. The level of service was not congruent with the price of the room and the quality of the property. Need to be hitting on all cylinders for me to consider staying again.
reviews.title: Oasis in the middle of the lava rocks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: I have never enjoyed a hotel stay more. I think having a business in Hawaii might make it easy to say I enjoyed it but theres something special about the quality of service from ALL the staff. they are so on the money, and real, and considerate. High five guys. I cant wait to come back!!!
reviews.title: Incredible Experience!!! Wow!!
A great place to stay
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for a few days in January 2013, and I was very happy here. I stayed in the north tower, and my room had a lanai looking out over a golf course. While it wasn't an ocean view, it was still really nice. The room was a good size; had a comfortable bed; and a clean and spacious bathroom. I had some problems with wifi in my room, but those got fixed with a phone call. (Tip: wifi is free if you joint the Fairmont President's Club.)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel itself is located on the coast itself, and there are some very pleasant beaches and fish ponds to walk along. The hotel grounds are quite impressive; there's a spectacular array of coloring and/or flowering plants that have been carefully laid out, and there are many man-made waterfalls on the property.
reviews.title: What a Delightful Surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you're going to be staying here long, you definitely need a car, as there's really nothing else beside another hotel in easy walking distance.
reviews.title: A great holiday stay
An unforgettable experience
reviews.text: The food at the hotel is fine (not great---just fine) and it's definitely overpriced, even for Hawaii. There's a nearby shopping center you can buy food at if you have a car.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I returned for a second stay at The Orchid and it was better than I remembered! My garden view room was large and airy and I love the white décor. Even though it was a very busy week between Christmas and New Year, the property never seemed crowded. The beach cabana rental (a set of chairs with a canvas hood) comes with a nice amenity basket filled with water, fruit and snacks. However, there’s no real need to rent a cabana since there is ample beach and pool seating, unless you like some shade as I do. Having dined at Brown’s before, I opted to go to Merriman’s in Waimea (a 20 minute drive), which was good.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simply Stunning - Go and stay here if you ever have the chance. Three things you must do - get room service breakfast to your balcony overlooking the gardens and the sea, dine at Browns and get a massage in the waterfalls.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Magic
Fantastic property but inconsistent.
reviews.text: We had an incredibly special time, in no small part due to this beautiful place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Fairmont Orchid for a week recently and were instantly blown away by the property. Impeccable grounds, postcard views, a fabulous beach, and ideal location made this one of the nicest places I have ever stayed. Rooms were spacious and comfortable (wife and I didn't ever complain about sleeping in a queen vs. our regular king bed) and the lanai deck was perfect spot for mornings and evenings. We made full use of the beach and bay, pool area, trails around property, and dined in all the restaurants at least once. We enjoyed exploring the tide pools and the activities available at the beach shack (paddle boarding, snorkeling, and kayaking in particular. We saw so many sea turtles around, we were practically tired of them by the end of the stay. The kids menu available in all restaurants is a HUGE plus for carefree dining - we even were able to order from Hale Kai 1 night as everyone was just too beat to go down for dinner after a day of fun in the sun. Seafood at Norio's was top-notch as we're the breakfasts at Orchid Court (get the Loco Moco or the pancakes!). Also, Brown's Deli was the perfect food and drink outlet for breakfasts and snacks - do yourself a favor and buy the tumbler for $20 and get free refills on some of the best coffee ever, iced coffee, and iced tea for the duration of the stay. The tumbler is top-notch as well.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Now for a bit of the negative. Although we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and the Fairmont, there were a lot of inconsistencies. Housekeeping was very iffy (sand not swept from bathroom, takeout trash left in room, no consistency in number of towels left for us). Restaurant service also spotty at times (warm hand towels 1 night and not another in same restaurant, bread served once in 3 visits to 1 particular restaurant prompting us to ask them if it was new and they said, No. It should be served every time). Also some long waits for orders to be taken after being seated promptly especially at breakfast. The 1 time I tried to utilize the concierge, I found him less than willing to help out after waiting a good 20 minutes in line for him. I was better off doing my own research and making my own reservations (surf lesson, whale watch, dinner, etc.).
reviews.title: Amazing grounds, disappointing rooms, they could do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: We have stayed here several times. The place is fantastic. Fairmont takes care of business. Great location, nice rooms, nice people. Two beach bars nice pool nice beach. No complaints. Free Internet with free presidents club membership.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night here in August. We were passing through on our way to somewhere else, so we did not get to experience everything this resort has to offer. With that in mind, here are our thoughts.
reviews.title: Large hotel, large hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely grounds, especially the gardens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Interesting things nearby, like the Pukao Petroglyphs
reviews.title: A solid choice on the Big Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is really a lovely property on the Hawaiian coast. The rooms are comfortable and the service is very good. Part of our stay was in a VERY spacious suite and part in a regular, deluxe room. The suite was much nicer needless to say but the regular room was certainly nothing to scoff at. The restaurants at the resort are pricey but the food is very good compared to some other resorts in the area. The buffet breakfast at The Orchid Court is really a stand out as the food is excellent, there is a range of options and the service is wonderful. The one thing the hotel could improve is the pool area which does not have enough shaded areas and umbrellas. The pool itself could also use a facelift as there are tiles missing on the sides and the water seems more oily than it should be at a property like this. I would recommend this place to anyone who plans on visiting the Big Island.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friend and i went scuba diving and choose the northwest part of the island to dive. Great idea as it is not as crowded. This hotel was fabulous. Rooms well maintained, Service fabulous and the ground beautiful. Has a beach. It is a big hotel and we were in the right wing facing the ocean but it was worth it. Quiet, the sound of the surf and no people noises. The beaches in hawaii are not close to the hotels which at first I did not like but all the hotels are like this as it is a volcanic island and they make the beaches. The food was excellent too.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was the last of four resorts we visited in Hawaii. The others were really good, but this one stood up to the competition. It's open and airy, with flowers everywhere. Unlike the other resorts, this one has natural shade on the beach, so cabanas aren't necessary, although they're available. There are historical areas along the shoreline, but a map is necessary. By law, the beach can't be blocked off, but the owners of a golf course near the resort have made it very hard to see where to go without getting onto the golf course itself.
reviews.title: Last but not least

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is absolutely gorgeous. We arrived just on noon, and were given access to our room straightaway, which was just perfect - modern, fresh, contemporary and comfortable. The grounds of this resort are beautiful. Every staff member we encountered was friendly, professional and helpful. Special mention to the reception, concierge and Browns Beach Hut (dinner) staff, who were particularly terrific. The dinners we had here were divine and staff just charming. Breakfasts were too good for words! This property has a lovely little beach to snorkel from - we saw lovely fish and plenty of turtles!! The pool area also is great, plenty of room to play or just laze. Loads of lounge chairs, and some with canvas shades that you can book. Concierge staff were very helpful in advice about things to see. The Luana Lounge is a relaxing, elegant place for a pre-dinner cocktail. I really don't have a single negative thing to say about this gorgeous property. I had high expectations, and they were certainly met. An observation - its not inexpensive. But you get what you pay for - and as far as I'm concerned, we paid 5 star prices and got 6 star service, ambience and enjoyment! We hated to leave, and cant wait to return!
reviews.title: Just perfection.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our third visit to the Orchid in four years, so we obviously like it very much. Every year we debate where we are going to go on vacation, this year we decided to go out of the country. We wanted a short flight to the Caribbean but at the last minute decided to go back to the Orchid. For us, the ten hour flight is long but so worth it once we arrive and we never regret it. The weather is always warm and sunny, the people are friendly and more restaurants are opening every year. The one year we went to USVI and regretted it (tropical storm, misquitoes, and closed restaurants due to it being the off season) so we have been back ever since.
reviews.title: See you next year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed a week and got upgraded to nice room free of charge. The hotel and grounds are beautiful. The room and amenities were very nice. Empty mini fridge for snacks. Lots of cables to hook devices into the TV (although weird to play iPod through TV rather than have a docking station). The restaurants were all good; we liked the sushi place best. The pool area is nice, but the chaise lounges are a bit worn out—sagging from a lot of use. We ended up getting chaise lounge “cabanas” (padded chaise lounges with shades) and thought they were totally worth it. Nice cocktails served poolside and in the lounge. A beautiful setting. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Had a great week!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: Have stayed here several times. Great location, perfect little cove, wonderful people and rooms and public areas are top notch. Will be back. Whole family loves it. Superbly sited, managed and maintained. Close to everything you want, far from the crowds.
reviews.title: Best on the big isle
Hawaii is paradise. Fairmont Orchid is underwhelming.
reviews.text: Full disclosure: I didn't even pay for this hotel, a friend picked up the tab, but I was still not satisfied with my stay. Hawaii is not a cheap destination, nor is the resort setting generally, but overall I left feeling very overcharged for an average experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My friend was traveling with medication that needed to be refrigerated so required a special cooler - which the hotel lost when we checked out. They ultimately found the cooler but it was not a reassuring experience.
reviews.title: Great location, dated interior, inconsistent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Dining options were decent but SO overpriced.
reviews.title: Fantastic Resort!!!

description: The Fairmont Orchid, Hawaii is a Kohala Coast Hawaii oceanfront luxury hotel and resort with white sand lagoon, Hawaiian Spa Without Walls, golf, tennis, five restaurants, extensive meeting and event facilities, and a year-round children’s program.
